questions.question_text:
What is the expected behavior of the following code?
the_list = "alpha;beta;gamma".split(";")
the_string = ''.join(the_list)
print(the_string.isalpha())

discussion.content: ANS: A
The Output should be TRUE - So Option A is the right. Both my IDE and ChatGPT gives the same answer.
D is correct

comments.content: Sorry the answer correct is A

D is wrong, the code you wrote is not in accordance with the one listed, since you are using double quotation marks, while the example uses 2 single quotation marks. 
If you try the_string = ''.join(the_list) with 2 single quotation marks as given, you will notice it works without raising an exception.

discussion.content:
D is the correct , 
the_string = ".join(the_list) should be :
the_string = "".join(the_list)
 so it raises an exception
